newsitem.title: USA: Saga Communications to buy radio station.
newsitem.headline: Saga Communications to buy radio station.

text.p: Saga Communications Inc said on Tuesday it had entered into a letter of intent to acquire radio station KEZT-FM in Ames, Iowa, for $3.2 million from Bunce Broadcasting Inc.
KEZT, a 100,000-watt station that serves the Des Moines market, will be Saga's sixth station in the greater Des Moines area.
The company expects to close the transaction, subject to the approval of the Federal Communications Commission, during the first quarter of 1997.
Following the KEZT acquisition, Saga said it will operate 34 radio stations and a television station serving 11 markets, mainly in the Midwest and Eastern Seaboard.
